subject: Release of retention money against bank guarantees.
text: HRrf4 <7cf4 <TTHT wfaarut 314 / Phone : 91-11-25074100/25074200 (Ma 9a67, 43r 4a67 3 ToA #AT4) 44 / Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India QA . /Extn : 2223 2318 2468 2553 (Ministry of Shipping, Road Transport and Highways) #1-5 & 6, #ier-10, ETrOT, 7} faoti-110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No_ 11041/21/2005-Admn: 09, 2006 PQLICY CIRCULAR: ADMNISTRATIONIFINANCE 121 /2006) (Decision taken on EW Division file No. NHAI/12OT1/EW-IIADBIPkg:-1/2004) This refersto Policy Circulars No. 21/2002 dated 23/9/2002 , 29/2002 dated 20/12/2002, 52/2003 dated 28/8/03 and 77/2004 dated  3/3/2004  regarding early release of retention money against bank guarantees otherwise than at the stages prescribed in the civil works contracts. Vide Circular No. 52/2003 and 77/2004,it was also prescribed that such early release of retention money will attract interest 6% p.a: for releases made on or after 28/8/2003. 2 It has been observed that in the contracts entered into with the contractors subsequent to the issuance of these circulars, the release of retention money has been  prescribed at various stages. In this regard, it is clarified that in case the retention money is released only at such stages as prescribed in the contracts (and the contracts do not specifically prescribe for of any interest on such release of retention money); such release of retention money in accordance with the conditions of the contracts will not attract levy of interest @ 6% p.a. as was prescribed for early release of retention money vide Circular 52/2003 & 77/2004.
